channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: America’s Last Penny Is Being Minted Today
item.description: The rapid-fire process of killing the penny is already causing some disruption.

item.title: The MAHA Movement Has a New Misunderstood Hero: Elizabeth Holmes
item.description: This tracks.

item.title: FYI: New ‘Avatar’ Movie Long AF
item.description: Apparently, 'Avatar: Fire and Ash,' out December 19, is 3 hours and 15 minutes long, same as 'Titanic.'

item.title: Here are the best Kindle deals right now
item.description: When it comes to finding a device to read ebooks, you have a few options to choose from. You can always buy a tablet or use your phone, but those devices are multipurpose and can be used for a ton of things, like surfing the web or doomscrolling on X or Bluesky. If you are […]

item.title: Data breach at mysterious Chinese firm reveals state-owned cyber weapons and even a list of targets
item.description: Leak at Knownsec exposes over 12,000 files detailing cyber weapons, espionage tools, and international data theft.

item.title: Amazon beats Nothing at its own game with this brilliant early Black Friday Nothing Phone 3 deal
item.description: The Nothing Phone 3 is one of the best value phones on the market, and perhaps the most unique-looking; the company has put it on sale for Black Friday, but Amazon’s offer is better.

item.title: Valve’s new VR streaming trick won’t just work with its own headset
item.description: Valve’s new streaming-first VR headset — the Steam Frame — employs a clever trick to help make game streaming feel as low-latency as possible. It’s called foveated streaming, and it means the headset requests a higher-quality image for the content that’s right in front of your eyes while lowering the resolution of your peripheral vision to reduce […]...

item.title: Is Jack Schlossberg the next Zohran Mamdani?
item.description: John F. Kennedy’s 32-year-old grandson is stepping into the spotlight with a Congressional bid, part of a new wave of young progressive politicians. Just a week after self-described democratic socialist Zohran Mamdani made history as New York City’s first Muslim to be elected mayor, fellow Democrat Jack Schlossberg—President John F. Kennedy’s (JFK’s) grandson—announced he is also running for office in New York City, in the Empire State’s 12th Congressional district. If elected, he would represent New York in the U.S. House of Representatives....

item.title: Microsoft’s Surface Laptop Is Marked Down by $350
item.description: Scoop this excellent Windows laptop for a fraction of its usual price.

item.title: Cybersecurity firm Deepwatch lays off dozens, citing move to “accelerate” AI investment
item.description: Deepwatch’s CEO told TechCrunch that the layoffs allow the company to accelerate investments in “AI and automation.”

item.title: We tried Valve’s new VR headset, PC, and controller — ask us anything!
item.description: Hi! I'm Jay Peters, a senior reporter here at The Verge. I'm perhaps the site's second-biggest Steam Deck fan, surpassed only by Sean Hollister, our unofficial handheld gaming PC reviewer. So you can imagine how excited we were to visit Valve's headquarters to try the company's three new hardware products: the Steam Frame, a streaming-focused […]

item.title: ElevenLabs strike deals with celebs to create AI audio
item.description: ElevenLabs struck a deal with actors Michael Caine and Matthew McConaughey to AI-generate their voices.

item.title: Apple TV’s most underrated mystery drama is back with a glitzy first episode that pays homage to ’60s Hollywood icons
item.description: Palm Royale creator, Abe Sylvia, reveals how two 60s stars inspired the mystery series’ dazzling season 2 opener.

item.title: This home theater newcomer just released a serious Sonos Beam rival – here’s why I love this small Dolby Atmos soundbar
item.description: My expectations for the Marshall Heston 60 were already sky-high, but it still met them – Sonos has some serious competition.

item.title: Watch this – the latest humanoid robots are both unnervingly sassy and comfortingly error-prone
item.description: New robots from China and Russia raise serious questions about the difficulty of creating humanoid robots and what these companies should be building.

item.title: Valve annonce une Steam Machine et relance la guerre des consoles : un cube pour défier PlayStation et Xbox
item.description: Valve ressort une vieille idée ratée, mais cette fois avec une arme secrète : une décennie d'apprentissage douloureux. La Steam Machine 2025 pourrait réussir là où son ancêtre a lamentablement échoué.

item.title: Yes, You Should Yell at Seagulls
item.description: New research suggests the annoying birds are sensitive to how we say things.

item.title: GPT-5.1 est là : voici ce qui change vraiment pour ChatGPT
item.description: OpenAI dévoile GPT-5.1, trois mois après GPT-5. Au programme : un ton plus naturel, huit personnalités au choix, et des améliorations ciblées en raisonnement.

item.title: Elon Musk’s X botched its security key switchover, locking users out
item.description: As part of an effort to retire the old Twitter.com domain, X is requiring passkey and security key users to re-enroll — but are getting stuck in endless loops and unable to finish.

item.title: How the Steam Frame compares to other VR headsets
item.description: Valve just announced the Steam Frame, a new standalone VR headset that can both stream games from a PC and play games locally thanks to an onboard Arm chip. The headset is quite a bit different from Valve’s previous model, the Index, which had to be tethered to a gaming computer with a physical wire. […]

item.title: On a comparé la Steam Machine à la PS5 Pro, la Xbox Series X et un PC gaming équivalent
item.description: Valve débarque sur le marché console avec une promesse alléchante : la puissance d'un PC gaming, l'écosystème Steam, et un prix "comparable à un PC avec caractéristiques similaires".

item.title: Valve’s New VR Headset Is (Thank God) All About Gaming
item.description: By leaning into streaming, the Steam Frame should be a proper foil to the Meta Quest.

item.title: Weibo's new open source AI model VibeThinker-1.5B outperforms DeepSeek-R1 on $7,800 post-training budget
item.description: Another day in late 2025, another impressive result from a Chinese company in open source artificial intelligence.Chinese social networking company Weibo's AI division recently released its open source VibeThinker-1.5B—a 1.5 billion parameter large language model (LLM) that is a fine-tuned variant of rival Chinese tech firm Alibaba's Qwen2.5-Math-1.5B. It's available now for free download and usage by researchers and enterprise developers—even for commercial purposes—under a permissive MIT License on Hugging Face, GitHub and ModelScope, with a technical report on open access science publishing...

item.title: George Lucas’ Museum Will Finally Open September 2026
item.description: Los Angeles' Lucas Museum of Narrative Art will feature more than 40,000 works, including, yes, a little bit of 'Star Wars.'

item.title: You know those fake USPS texts? Google says it’s found who’s behind them
item.description: The company aims to dismantle ‘Lighthouse,’ a platform accused of enabling global text-based identity theft. If you’ve ever been hit with a sketchy text warning you of an overdue toll road payment or mysterious U.S. Postal Service fees, you’ve likely been targeted by one of the largest cyber scams sweeping the globe.

item.title: Valve thinks Arm has ‘potential’ for SteamOS handhelds, laptops, and more
item.description: Valve won’t talk about a Steam Deck 2. It probably wants to keep the attention on its just-announced living room console, comfy new controller, and Arm-based headset instead. But now that the company is preparing to sell an Arm headset, one that can even run Android apps, there’s an obvious question. Is Arm a one-off […]

item.title: Court rules that OpenAI violated German copyright law; ordered it to pay damages
item.description: A German court ruled that OpenAI’s ChatGPT violated the nation’s copyright laws by training its language models on licensed musical work without permission.

item.title: Steam Machine : Valve lance une console de salon
item.description: Après des mois, voire des années, de rumeurs et autres fuites, Valve a fini par lever le voile sur non pas une nouveauté matérielle, mais… trois ! Parmi lesquelles un appareil qui pourrait bien faire des ravages dans les salons.

item.title: This Is What a Star Looks Like Just 26 Hours After It Explodes
item.description: Astronomers have captured a supernova in its earliest stages—and the aftermath is unexpectedly olive-shaped.

item.title: China Accuses United States of $13 Billion Bitcoin Mining Pool Hack
item.description: Some in the crypto community are skeptical.

item.title: Anthropic’s Claude Takes Control of a Robot Dog
item.description: Anthropic believes AI models will increasingly reach into the physical world. To understand where things are headed, it asked Claude to program a quadruped.

item.title: OpenAI says the brand-new GPT-5.1 is ‘warmer’ and has more ‘personality’ options
item.description: OpenAI is releasing GPT-5.1 today, an update to the flagship model it released in August. OpenAI calls it an “upgrade” to GPT-5 that “makes ChatGPT smarter and more enjoyable to talk to.” The new models include GPT-5.1 Instant and GPT-5.1 Thinking. The former is “warmer, more intelligent, and better at following your instructions” than its […]

item.title: Valve is welcoming Android games into Steam
item.description: You can think of the just-announced Steam Frame as a wireless VR headset for your PC, or a Steam Deck for your face. But another way to think about it is that Valve is finally entering the mobile realm. The Frame doesn’t just run Windows games on its Arm-based Qualcomm Snapdragon chip — Valve will […]

item.title: LG fait du XXL avec cet écran OLED incurvé de 45 pouces en promo à -600 € pendant le pré-Black Friday
item.description: Directement sur le site de LG il y a des offres qui entrent dans le cadre du pré-Black Friday avec le moniteur LG 45GX900A-B à 1 098,99 euros au lieu de 1 699,99 euros.

item.title: Steam Frame officialisé : voici le casque VR de Valve qui veut rendre obsolète votre Meta Quest
item.description: Valve débarque enfin sur le marché de la VR standalone (sans le PC) avec une promesse : jouer à toute votre bibliothèque Steam sans fil. Mais derrière l'enthousiasme, il y a quelques compromis qui risquent de faire grincer des dents.

item.title: Steam Frame vs Meta Quest 3: Valve's VR headset swings at the king, but we're missing one key detail
item.description: Valve's new Steam Frame headset is here to take on the Meta Quest 3, but which one should you buy? Here's how the two VR titans compare.

item.title: Valve’s New Steam Machine Could Disrupt Console Gaming as We Know It
item.description: It's not a "GameCube" per se, but Valve's Steam Machine will bring your Steam library to your living room.

item.title: Steam Machine vs Steam Deck: the 4 biggest differences explained
item.description: Valve has just surprised us all with its new gaming Steam Machine, but how exactly does it fare against the Steam Deck?

item.title: iOS 26.2 beta adds new Liquid Glass customization, alarms in the Reminders app, and more
item.description: Apple released the iOS 26.2 beta 1 last week, introducing the option to adjust the Liquid Glass appearance of the lock screen clock, and more.
